casebody.data:
STATE of Missouri, Respondent,
v.
Jamel Wendell YATES, Appellant. No. ED 106174 Missouri Court of Appeals, Eastern District, DIVISION THREE. Filed: July 9, 2019 FOR APPELLANTS, Kristina Starke Olson, 1010 Market Street, Suite 1100, St. Louis, Missouri 63101, Nancy A. McKerrow, 1400 Forum Blvd, Suite 1C #203, Columbia, Missouri 65203. FOR RESPONDENTS, Garrick Aplin, Julia E. Rives, Eric Schmitt, P.O. Box 899, Jefferson City, Missouri 65102. Before Sherri B. Sullivan, P.J., James M. Dowd, J., and Robin Ransom, J.

ORDER

PER CURIAM

Jamel Yates appeals from the judgment of the Circuit Court of the City of St. Louis convicting him of first-degree assault and armed criminal action. We affirm.

An extended opinion would have no precedential value. The parties have been furnished with a memorandum for their information only, setting forth the reasons for this order pursuant to Rule 30.25.
